content.en:
# Project Chat

The project chat enables direct real-time communication with your team. All messages are automatically synchronized and immediately visible to all team members.

## What is the Project Chat?

The project chat is an integrated messaging system specifically designed for collaboration in PR projects. You can:

- **Chat in real-time** - All messages are synced live
- **Mention colleagues** - Use @-mentions to draw attention to specific people
- **React to messages** - Give quick feedback with emojis (ğŸ‘, ğŸ‘, ğŸ¤š)
- **Share files** - Share assets from the project directly in the chat
- **Access everywhere** - Available on all project pages via the floating chat widget

## Prerequisites

- You must be assigned to the project as a team member
- The project must already be created
- You need the role "Member", "Admin" or "Owner"

## Opening the Chat

There are two ways to use the project chat:

### 1. Floating Chat Widget (recommended)

The floating chat widget is always available and remains visible across all project pages.

**How to open it:**

1. Click on the **chat icon** (ğŸ’¬) at the bottom right
2. The chat window opens as an overlay
3. You see the last 50 messages
4. To minimize, click on the downward arrow

[Screenshot: Floating chat button at bottom right with badge]

**Unread messages:** A red badge shows you how many new messages you've missed.

### 2. Team Chat Tab in Project

Alternatively, you can open the chat as a full tab:

1. Navigate to your project
2. Select the **"Team Chat"** tab (if available)
3. The chat is displayed in full-screen mode

## Sending Messages

To send a message:

1. Click into the **input field** at the bottom of the chat
2. Type your message
3. Press **Enter** or click the **send button** (â¡ï¸)

[Screenshot: Message input with send button]

**Keyboard shortcuts:**
- **Enter** - Send message
- **Shift + Enter** - Insert new line

> **Tip:** Your message is sent immediately to all team members. You can edit or delete it within 15 minutes.

## Mentioning Team Members (@-Mentions)

To notify a specific person on the team, use @-mentions:

1. Type **@** in the input field
2. A dropdown with all team members opens
3. Continue typing to filter the list (e.g., "@Anna")
4. Select the person using **arrow keys** or **mouse click**
5. Press **Enter** to insert the mention

[Screenshot: Mention dropdown with team members]

**Mentioned people receive:**
- A **push notification** in the software
- Their mention is **highlighted in yellow** in the chat
- They can jump directly to the project via the notification

> **Tip:** You can mention multiple people in one message. Each mentioned person receives a separate notification.

## Reacting to Messages (Reactions)

Instead of replying, you can quickly react with an emoji:

1. **Hover your mouse** over a message
2. The **reaction bar** appears on the right
3. Click on an emoji:
   - ğŸ‘ **Like** - You agree or like it
   - ğŸ‘ **Dislike** - You disagree
   - ğŸ¤š **You decide** - You abstain or want others to decide

[Screenshot: Message with reaction bar]

**Important to know:**
- You can only give **one reaction** per message
- Clicking the same reaction again **removes** it
- Clicking a different reaction **replaces** the old one
- Hover over a reaction to see **who reacted**

## Sharing Files and Assets

You can share assets from your project directly in the chat:

1. Click the **paperclip icon** (ğŸ“) in the input field
2. The **asset picker** opens
3. Select an asset from the project library
4. The asset is inserted as a link in your message
5. Send the message as usual

[Screenshot: Asset picker modal]

**Benefits:**
- Team members can **view** the asset directly in the chat
- Assets are **secure** - only project members have access
- **No duplicates** - Assets remain in the project library

> **Tip:** You can also share multiple assets in one message.

## Inserting Emojis

To brighten up your messages with emojis:

1. Click the **smiley icon** (ğŸ˜Š) in the input field
2. The **emoji picker** opens with 32 frequently used emojis
3. Click an emoji to insert it at the cursor position

[Screenshot: Emoji picker]

**Text-to-Emoji Shortcuts:**
You can also use text emoticons that are automatically converted:
- `:)` â†’ ğŸ˜Š
- `:(` â†’ ğŸ˜
- `:D` â†’ ğŸ˜ƒ
- `<3` â†’ â¤ï¸
- `;)` â†’ ğŸ˜‰

## Editing Messages

If you want to correct a typo:

1. **Hover your mouse** over your own message
2. Click the **pencil icon** (âœï¸)
3. The text becomes editable
4. Change the text
5. Press **Enter** to save the change
6. Or press **Escape** to cancel

[Screenshot: Message in edit mode]

**Important:**
- You can only edit **your own** messages
- Editing is only possible **within 15 minutes** after sending
- Edited messages show an **"Edited" badge**
- The complete **change history** is saved (GDPR-compliant)

## Deleting Messages

To remove a message:

1. **Hover your mouse** over your own message
2. Click the **trash icon** (ğŸ—‘ï¸)
3. Confirm the deletion in the dialog
4. The message is removed immediately

**Important:**
- You can only delete **your own** messages
- Deletion is only possible **within 15 minutes** after sending
- The deletion is logged in the **audit logs**

> **Note:** Project admins can delete the entire chat history via settings.

## Clearing Chat History (Admins only)

As a project admin, you can delete the entire chat history:

1. Click the **3-dot menu** at the top right in the floating chat
2. Select **"Clear chat history"**
3. Confirm the deletion in the dialog
4. The complete history is permanently deleted

**Caution:** This action cannot be undone!

## Searching Messages

To find older messages:

1. Scroll up in the chat
2. The last **50 messages** are automatically loaded
3. Use **browser search** (Ctrl+F / Cmd+F) for specific terms

> **Tip:** For larger projects, we recommend documenting important information in project notes.

## Frequently Asked Questions

**Can I read messages later?**
Yes, all messages are permanently saved. You can scroll back at any time.

**Why can't I send messages?**
You must be assigned to the project as a team member. Contact the project manager.

**Are messages synchronized in real-time?**
Yes, all team members see new messages immediately (live updates via Firebase).

**Is there a limit for messages?**
Yes, you can send a maximum of 10 messages per minute (rate limiting). This prevents spam.

**Are my messages secure?**
Yes, all messages are:
- **Encrypted** during transmission (HTTPS)
- **Isolated** per organization (multi-tenancy)
- **Access-restricted** to team members
- **GDPR-compliant** stored

**What happens if I'm not on the team?**
You see a warning and can't send messages, but can read existing messages (if you were previously on the team).

## Next Steps

- [Use Internal Notes](/help/internal-notes) - For structured team communication
- [Notifications](/help/notifications) - Settings for @-mentions
- [Manage Project Team](/help/project-settings) - Add/remove team members
